question.title: Handle circular dependency in CDI
question.body:
I have situation like this. I cannot see any errors but I am not getting my results.

@ApplicationScoped
public class A {

    private B b;


    @Inject
    public A(B b) {
        this.b = b;
    }
}

@Singleton
public class B {

    private A a;


    @Inject
    public B(A a) {
        this.a = a;
    }
}

Is this type of dependency injection is wrong?

Can any one help me with this.

answers.body:
ditch the constructors all together and do

@ApplicationScoped
public class A {

    @Inject
    private B b;

}

@Singleton
public class B {

    @Inject
    private A a;

}

if you have code in your constructors move it in to a @PostConstructor

@ApplicationScoped
public class A {

    @Inject
    private B b;

    @PostConstruct
    public void init() {
        b.blah()
    }

}
